data.title: 100+ Quirky Bollywood Dumb Charades Movies Names to Level up Your Game
data.meta_description: Dive into the vibrant world of Hindi Movies of Dumb Charades to give your competitors unique and challenging movie names in your next game of Dumb Charades.
data.text:
Are you ready to take your game night to the next level with a Bollywood twist? We’re talking quirky dumb charades Bollywood Movie Names, iconic dialogues, and unforgettable characters that will test your acting skills and movie knowledge. Forget about overused old Bollywood Movies names and dive into the vibrant world of Hindi Movies of Dumb Charades to give your competitors unique and challenging movie names in your next game of Dumb Charades.

New Bollywood Hindi Movies For Dumb Charades

Whether you are enjoying a house party or want to add oomph to your office game day, this game of dumb charades can help you with that. If you want to win the title of ultimate charades champion, then keep in mind this new list of Bollywood movie Names of Dum Sharas.

Old Bollywood Hindi Movies for Dumb Charades

1. Kaalakaandi :

Kaalakaandi is a drama movie that explores life’s surprises, love, mortality, greed, betrayal. Saif Ali khan is in the lead role in this movie.

2. Love per Square Foot :

The film portrays the story of Sanjay and Karina, Starring Vicky Kaushal and Angira Dhar trying to find a house in Mumbai.

3. Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety :

Childhood friends Sonu and Titu’s friendship is tested when an innocent Titu decides to marry Sweety, who is not just behind his money but is hell-bent on breaking their friendship too.

4. Beyond the Clouds :

Amir tries to dodge the police after they raid one of his drug dealings. Amir’s sister gets imprisoned while trying to save him and the situation gets worse. The movie is Starring Ishan Khatter

5. Nanu ki Jaanu :

Nanu Ki Jaanu movie released in 2018. It is an Indian Hindi-language horror comedy film directed by Faraz Haider, starring Abhay Deol and Patralekha.

6. Meri Nimmo :

It’s the story of an 8-year-old boy who likes his friend Nimmo, a 20-year-old girl. Once the boy finds out that Nimmo is engaged, he tries everything to make her fall in love with him.

7. Omerta :

Omerta is a biographical crime drama film directed by Hansal Mehta. Rajkumar Rao is in the main role of Ahmed Omar Saeed Sheikh, a British terrorist of Pakistani descent.

8. Khajoor Pe Atke :

Directed by Harsh Chhaya, Khajoor Pe Atke is a comedy film and a very hard to Guess Dumb Charades Movie.

9. Karwaan :

Everyone heard the name of this movie but it is not easy to act on it.

10. Manmarziyaan :

Showcasing the new-age romance, Manmarziyaan is the story of Rumi who is stuck between her former boyfriend and her husband.

11. Thugs of Hindostan :

The movie has some bigger stars like Amitabh Bachchan, Aamir Khan and Katrina Kaif.

12. Mohalla Assi :

Mohalla Assi tells the story of Banaras ghats, foreigners and their spiritual intentions. Sunny Deol plays the main role in it.

Hard to Guess Dumb Charades Movies

13. The Accidental Prime Minister :

Based on the life of former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, it is a 2019 Hindi biographical drama movie starring Anupam Kher, Akshaye Khanna, Suzanne Bernert and Aahana Kumra.

14. Why Cheat India :

Featuring Emraan Hashmi and Shreya Dhanwanthary in the lead roles, Why Cheat India is an Indian Hindi-language crime drama film written and directed by Soumik Sen.

15. Fraud Saiyaan :

Con artist in North India convinces women to marry them to enjoy their money.

16. Bombairiya :

Meghna, a PR agent’s phone gets stolen and all the things get worse.

Level Up the Difficulty of Dum Sharas Game:

Double Entendre Delights: Dhadkan (heartbeat), Andaz Apna Apna (style our own), Chori Chori Chupke Chupke (secretly, secretly): These titles play on multiple meanings, leaving your team guessing until the very end.

Literal Translations: Ram Balram (Rama and Balarama), Jaane Tu… Ya Jaane Na (know you…or don’t know you), Chupke Chupke (silently, silently): While seemingly straightforward, these titles can be surprisingly tricky to act out without giving away too much.

Forgotten Gems: Ek Baar Phir (one more time), Saath Saath (together, together), Chhoti Si Baat (a small thing): These lesser-known classics might stump even the most dedicated Bollywood fans, adding a layer of nostalgia and challenge.

Embrace the Camp:

Action-Packed Titles: Ghayab Ho Gaya (he disappeared), Coolie No. 1 (porter no. 1), Karan Arjun: These titles scream action and adventure, perfect for energetic performances and creative charades.

Romantic Romps: Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge (the heart will take the bride away), Kuch Kuch Hota Hai (something happens), Hum Tumhare Hain Sanam (we are yours, Sanam): These iconic love stories offer ample opportunities for dramatic poses, romantic gestures, and maybe even a Bollywood dance move or two.

Comedy Chaos: Andaz Apna Apna (style our own), Hera Pheri (chaos), Golmaal: Fun Unlimited: Embrace the absurdity and unleash your inner comedian with these hilarious titles.

Bonus Tips:

Think beyond the title: Use iconic scenes, dialogues, or character traits to give more clues.

Act it out creatively: Don’t be afraid to use props, accents, or even sing a few lines!

Adjust difficulty: Mix up easy and challenging titles to keep everyone engaged.

So, gather your friends, dust off your acting chops, and get ready to unleash the magic of Bollywood in your next game of Dumb Charades. Remember, the more creative and outrageous you are, the more laughter and fun you’ll have!
